name: Great Wall
description: More than 2200 years ago, the first emperor of China, after uniting the country, ordered the construction of this wall. Although what remains today is mainly from the Ming dynasty that existed from 14th to 17th century, we can see that the first emperor wanted to defend China from the intrusion of various nomadic powers. There must have been lots of hurdles to overcome to construct the great wall. Lots of people may have been injured or even died during the construction. But we see the purpose of this monumental structure. This was to protect lives and wealth of people.

name: Segovia Aqueduct
description: The Aqueduct of Segovia is known to have been built at the end of the 1st century by Roman engineers. Roman engineers defined three dimensions of quality: Utilitas, Firmitas, and Venustas. Utilitas is the utility of the structure, Firmitas means structural integrity, and Venustas is aesthetics. Thanks to these quality criteria, the Aqueduct had been in use to transport water until 19th century.

name: Panama Canal
description: Panama Canal links the Pacific and the Atlantic Oceans. It was French people who first worked on this construction. After a successful completion of the Suez Canal, the French tried to complete this project but in vain. Technical difficulties, hostile climate, and political issues had led to the failure. It was Americans who took over the construction in early 20th century. They tried to solve those problems identified by the French people. They used the lock-approach to have different water elevations in the canal. They controlled mosquitos to deal with the disease of yellow fever. They even supported a revolution that led to the formation of Republic of Panama.

name: Incheon Bridge
description: Incheon Bridge is a part of the 21.38 km long highway linking Incheon and Seoul in Korea. As you can see, this is a cable-stayed bridge. The main span between the two pylons is 800 m, and the height of each pylon is 230.5 m. The total cost was about $2.2 billion. This structure was completed in 2009 using the so-called public-private-partnership approach. Not just tax payers’ money but also private entities money were used for this construction.

name: Burj Khalifa
description: Burj Khalifa is the tallest building of the world located in Dubai. The height is 829.8 m and there is 163 floors. This was completed in 2010. It cost about $1.5 billion. Suppose you have this money of $1.5 billion, and your job is to build this monumental structure. What would you do?

name: Tower Eiffel
description: In 1889, to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the French Revolution, the Paris Universal Exposition was held, and this tower was built as a symbol of the exposition. It was constructed with a method of erecting four iron columns on a platform the size of a football field and then encasing them in concrete before adding the body of the iron tower on top. The total weight of the metal structure of the Eiffel Tower is 7,300 tons, and including non-metal materials, it amounts to approximately 10,000 tons. Recognized as a pioneering example of modern architecture utilizing iron, concrete, and glass, the exposed iron structure of the Eiffel Tower influenced the construction of subsequent structures such as railway stations and bridges. It has since become a prominent tourist attraction representing Paris.

name: 1915 Çanakkale Bridge
description: Located in the Dardanelles strait, connecting Lapseki and Gelibolu, this is a major bridge inaugurated in March 2022 after commencement in April 2018. With a total length of 3,563 meters, a main span length of 2,023 meters, a main tower height of 334 meters, and a main cable diameter of 881 mm, it involved a workforce of 17,000 people and took 2,634,430 days to complete. It is the first suspension bridge with a main span exceeding 2,000 meters and was constructed by South Korea's DL Engineering & Construction. The project followed a Design-Build approach, where the design and construction teams collaborated concurrently. Serving as a crucial link between Europe and Asia in southern Turkey, it plays a vital role.

name: Tower Bridge
description: The bridge, built over the River Thames in central London, combines the structure of a suspension and a bascule bridge. It has a total length of 244.1 meters, with two towers on either side of the bridge's center, each measuring 64.9 meters. Between them lies a bascule bridge with a span of 62.0 meters, allowing passage for vessels of up to 42.5 meters in height. The space between each tower and the riverbank is spanned by a 82.3-meter-long suspension bridge. Completed in 1894, it has become an iconic bridge in London.

name: Suez Canal
description: Connecting the Mediterranean and Red Seas, the canal links the North Atlantic and the Indian Ocean, bridging Europe and Asia without circumventing Africa by sea. It also serves military-strategic purposes. Ferdinand de Lesseps established the Suez Canal Company in 1858 for its construction, which took place under Ottoman Empire support from 1859 to 1869. It was officially opened on November 17, 1869. In August 2014, the Egyptian government began construction on the Suez Canal Expansion Project, extending the Ballah Bypass by 35 km to reduce transit time through the canal. The expansion aims to double the canal's capacity from 49 to 97 ships per day. The cost, totaling 59.4 billion Egyptian pounds (approximately 9 billion dollars), was funded through investment certificates issued exclusively to Egyptian corporations and individuals. The expanded New Suez Canal was opened on August 6, 2015.
